newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Finnish poll cuts Liberal seats in EP.
newsitem.headline: Finnish poll cuts Liberal seats in EP.

text.p: The European Parliament's Liberal group is set to lose one member following Finland's election on Sunday, while the United Left/Nordic Green Left group will gain one new seat.
Finland's 16 seats are expected to be distributed within the Parliament as follows, preliminary results show:
-- European Liberal Democratic and Reformist Party (ELDR), four (down from five)
-- Party of European Socialists (PES), four (no change)
-- United Left/Nordic Green Left (EUL/GUE), two (up from one)
The Socialists will remain the 626-member parliament's biggest group with 215 members, followed by the mainly Christian Democrat EPP with 174 members.
The ELDR has 51 members, the EUL/GUE 33 and the Greens 27.
The Socialist group lost two members following Austria's election on October 13, while far right parties gained one. Austria now has 21 Euro-MPs
The new Finnish and Austrian members should take their seats at the parliament's November 11-15 plenary session, a parliament official said.
